      • addInstance

        public void addInstance(String instanceId,
                        String path)
                 throws JasDBStorageException
        Description copied from interface: DBSession
        Adds a new instance with the given path to the DB. The session still is attached to the original connecting instance. @see switchInstance or @see addAndSwitchInstance for switching to another instance.
        Specified by:
        addInstance in interface DBSession
        Parameters:
        instanceId - The id of the instance, should not exist already
        path - The path where to store the instance and bag data
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to to add an instance

      • addAndSwitchInstance

        public void addAndSwitchInstance(String instanceId,
                                 String path)
                          throws JasDBStorageException
        Description copied from interface: DBSession
        Adds a new instance with the given path to the DB. The session will switch to the newly created instance.
        Specified by:
        addAndSwitchInstance in interface DBSession
        Parameters:
        instanceId - The id of the instance, should not exist already
        path - The path where to store the instance and bag data
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to to add an instance

      • switchInstance

                    throws JasDBStorageException
        Description copied from interface: DBSession
        Switches the current session to a new instance
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • deleteInstance

        public Instance deleteInstance(String instanceId)
                        throws JasDBStorageException
        Description copied from interface: DBSession
        This deletes an instance all its related bags and entities permanently. This operation cannot be rolled back and is permanent. If the resources are in use this operation will fail. When the session is bound to the instance to be deleted the session switches to the default instance if present.
        Specified by:
        deleteInstance in interface DBSession
        Parameters:
        instanceId - The instanceId of the instance and related resources (bags, entities) to delete
        Returns:
        Returns the now active session instance, in case the instance was deleted the session switches to the default instance.
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to delete the instance and related resources (bags, entities)

      • getBag

        public EntityBag getBag(String bagName)
                 throws JasDBStorageException
        Description copied from interface: DBSession
        Retrieves an existing bag if this exists on the connected instance, in case the bag does not exist the method will return null
        Specified by:
        getBag in interface DBSession
        Parameters:
        bagName - The name of the bag
        Returns:
        The bag if existing in the database, will return null if it does not exist
